Second thing, what about mage nerfs that had no reason whatsoever?

Like Swain and Karthus? They weren't OP. Back then they were at **almost **50% winrate or so. Yet they received a nerf.

---

What about AD item nerfs? When it became obvious and FINE that ADC can run with 
400 AD, 
1,5 AS, 
50%+ Crit, 
20% LS (or more)
120 MR on top of that?

ADCs in season 3 couldn't muster even half of those stats and they were more than FINE.

And mages? They used to be able to get 1k AP. Now, unless you play Veigar 600 is almost definite max you can get (and obviously ou'd be squishy as hell).

ADCs run scaling builds. Mages have those too. Only they don't have to go for them because they have a level advantage as solo laners. 

AD item nerfs? How about Maw? How about lethality replacing flat armor pen (ADCs stopped going for armor pen builds after that after all)? How about the fact that, on the rare occasion that an ADC does become p/b or first pick material, they get nerfed?

Mages don't get that much AP anymore because there's always that one of them that bursts you down 100-0 or clears waves indefinitely. As such, combos are slower and have more counterplay but mages can kite better and offer things for their team that aren't pure damage. 

1000 AP is still possible with a Seraph's build, especially with Baron buff. Still, it's hilarious to watch people say there's damage creep when the standard AP builds and kits have significantly less AP.

Swain and Karthus had dumb and cheesy lv 1 CC. It was stupidly punishing to play against and a champion's strength shouldn't rely on carelessness on their enemy's part. Oh, they had a higher winrate than 50% when DFT was released, trust me, Riot just leaped at the chance to nerf that crap and then nerfed DFT too.

Rylai's will be better on actual mage tanks. That's a fact.

> AD item nerfs? How about Maw?

Lets start with Maw was not nerfed?
1. It was defensive item to begin with
2. Had GAINED more AD than before, but now only when passive triggers
3. Defensive item having armor pen is misleading. So it got something else, but just as good.

> How about lethality replacing flat armor pen

Armor pen/lethality is assassins main stat.

Just as AP is for mages and crit is for ADC

Riot nerfed armor pen (lethality) cause ADCs were moaning that assassins were too strong. So they shot in their own foot.

> How about the fact that, on the rare occasion that an ADC does become p/b or first pick material, they get nerfed?

Just like anyone else minus Lee Sin.
Still you can play a successful game without mages, but you can't do that without ADCs.
They became most essential class in LoL.

> Mages don't get that much AP anymore because there's always that one of them that bursts you down 100-0 or clears waves indefinitely.

In old days we had even more mages capable of doing that. Yet it was fine'ish.
Also there are some ADCs who can do the same shit. burst you and clear waves and yet it's fine, right?

Btw, now when mages have difficult time with mana regen and they have to strain their builds to get something like FQC, saying something like "indefinitely" is a lie. A bad and biased lie.

> As such, combos are slower and have more counterplay but mages can kite better

Combos aren't slower. Combos are simply weaker. They'd be slower if Riot added some 1s cast time interval between spells. But they took a heavy chunk of AP mages used to build.

And.. I could live with that, really, if not for the fact that AD itemization is only getting better.
More MR options, lifesteal and crit are at their strongest since ever.

They simply nerfed them for no bigger reason. They couldn;t even give a good explanation in patch notes.

We have Rylai in 3 stages. Old, buffed (the one we have right now) and nerfed.

Old Rylai was fine and noone said anything to change it. Riot did it and buffed Rylai for no reason.
They ofcourse did it stupidly and made it must have for any AP stacking mage.
Now they want to nerf it. Okay.. But they want to nerf it FAR below of OLD Rylais stats.

And in the end what we will receive: Medium AP, Medium HP, crappy-slow

Anyways it rather will fail. Lets just forget about passive and focus on AP and HP and gold cost.

2. Low cost (with TERRIBLE gold efficiency) means this is by no means endgame item. Thus it won't be worth a flying fart once game gets to final minutes. That amount of HP it gives is worth 1 crit from ADC.
3. As mentioned before, terrible gold efficiency. We are throwing about 30% of its stats (and passives) worth to trash.
4. i doubt any respected mage would get Rylai instead of ROA now. Which means ROA will too be nerfed.

Effectively, this isn't just that mages are getting nerfed, but that they're getting their mid to late game nerfed by having their power progression hard-capped sooner, with nothing else to show for it. It's probable that the game needs some degree of blanket nerfing to all the damage going on, but so far that hasn't yet really applied to AD itemization, especially marksman itemization, which considering the already central role of marksmen in the game, doesn't feel fair.

I'm not entirely sure how to feel about this. On one hand, I'm personally not a fan of stat amplifiers, but on the other, I don't like how this takes more late-game power away from AP champions. A lot of buffs to AP and tanky items so far have been cost reductions, too, whereas AD items, especially marksman items, retain consistently higher costs, and usually more raw power as well. This is frustrating, because this means non-marksmen tend to cap out quicker and feel like they can't enhance their power any further, whereas marksmen get late-game dominance handed to them by raw statistical superiority. Super-early itemization is also a lot easier for AD champions than it is for AP or tanky champions, since Long Swords cost significantly less than Amp Tomes and Ruby Crystals, so it just feels like there's altogether a major skew in itemization and power progression overall, one that need not exist.
